operations.target_text: Guest Network Access: Visitors to the Company can access guest networks by registering with the office personnel, bypassing the need for a formal access request.
operations.comment: You indicated that you do not have an office, so this section should be removed. No office = no guest network needed; Having office = visitors need controlled network access for security.
You indicated you use Azure DevOps for version control, so this section should remain. No version control = no source code to protect; Using version control = IP protection needed.

operations.target_text: Password management systems should be user-friendly
operations.comment: You indicated Todoist which is not a password management tool. This section should be reviewed as Todoist is a task management tool, not a password manager. No password tool = section removed; Using specific tool = policy references actual system.

operations.target_text: All requests will be sent by email to <email>
operations.replacement: All requests will be submitted through our Custom Ticketing system
operations.comment: You indicated using a Custom Ticketing system for access requests. Email = simple but no tracking; Ticketing system = proper audit trails; Chat = fast but informal; Manager approval = personal but creates bottlenecks.

You selected a custom access review timeframe. We recommend quarterly reviews for most companies. If you operate in highly critical industries with complex or large company structure (1000+ employees), you might consider monthly reviews. Small companies and startups can get away with annual reviews.
You selected a custom termination timeframe. We recommend 24 business hours for most companies. Consider shorter timelines if customers request it. Longer than 1 week looks suspicious to auditors.
